title: Apfelkuchen (Apple Cake)
description: This traditional German Apfelkuchen is a delightful apple cake that combines a soft, yeasted dough with tender, spiced apples and a buttery crumb topping. Perfect for Easter brunch or any cozy gathering, its warm cinnamon and nutmeg flavors evoke nostalgic memories and invite you to savor every bite.
ingredients: 3 large apples, peeled, cored, and sliced
instructions: Grease the bottom and sides of a 9x13-inch baking dish or a 9-inch springform pan.

In a large bowl, beat 2 ¼ cups flour, warm milk, ¼ cup sugar, active dry yeast, 6 tablespoons softened butter, vanilla extract, and a pinch of salt with an electric mixer on high speed until the dough is smooth, about 5 minutes.
Spread the dough evenly into the prepared baking dish, pressing it up the sides.
Press the sliced apples evenly into the dough.
In a separate bowl, mix 1 cup sugar, ¾ cup flour, chopped candied lemon peel (if using), ground cinnamon, ground nutmeg, and a pinch of salt.
Cut in ½ cup butter with a knife or pastry blender until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Sprinkle the crumb topping evenly over the apples.
Allow the dough to rise in a warm place for 30 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Bake the cake in the preheated oven until golden brown and the apples are tender, about 35 minutes.
Let the cake cool slightly before serving.
tips: For the best texture, ensure your milk is warm but not hot to activate the yeast properly. Use firm, tart apples like Granny Smith for a perfect balance of sweetness and acidity. Don’t skip the crumb topping—it adds a wonderful buttery crunch that complements the soft apples.

structured_content.content: Apfelkuchen is a beloved German apple cake that combines a tender yeasted dough with juicy, spiced apples and a buttery crumb topping. Its inviting aroma and comforting flavors make it a standout dish for Easter brunch or any special occasion.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Quick and easy to make in under 1 hour 25 minutes
  • Restaurant-quality flavors at home
  • Perfect for Easter brunch, family gatherings, or cozy weekend treats
  • Uses simple pantry staples and fresh apples
  • The crumb topping adds a delightful texture contrast

structured_content.content: I first tasted Apfelkuchen in 6th grade when our teacher brought treats from a local German bakery. The warm spices and soft apples instantly captured my heart and have remained a nostalgic favorite ever since.

• Main ingredient: Fresh, firm apples like Granny Smith or Honeycrisp work best for a balance of tartness and sweetness; peel, core, and slice them evenly.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Ground cinnamon and nutmeg add warm spice notes; candied lemon peel is optional but adds a lovely citrus brightness.
  • Supporting ingredients: Active dry yeast ensures a light, fluffy dough; butter enriches both dough and crumb topping for a tender crumb.
  • Equipment needed: Electric mixer for smooth dough, 9x13-inch baking dish or springform pan, knife or pastry blender for crumb topping.

Preparation:
Mix the dough ingredients with an electric mixer until smooth, about 5 minutes. Grease your baking dish and spread the dough evenly, pressing it up the sides. Press apple slices into the dough and prepare the crumb topping.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Sprinkle the crumb topping over the apples, then allow the dough to rise for 30 minutes in a warm spot. Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C) and bake for about 35 minutes until golden and apples are tender.
Finishing Touches:
Let the cake cool slightly before slicing. Serve warm or at room temperature for the best flavor and texture.

upload.context: Beautiful finished dish with vibrant colors and appetizing presentation

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Use warm milk (not hot) to activate yeast without killing it
  • Don’t skip the 30-minute rise to ensure a light, fluffy dough
  • Look for a golden-brown crust and tender apples as signs it’s done
  • Store leftovers covered at room temperature for up to 2 days or refrigerate; reheat gently before serving

structured_content.content: Sharing this Apfelkuchen with family always brings back fond memories and fills the room with warmth and joy. It’s a dish that invites conversation and comfort, perfect for making any occasion feel special.

Enhance the cake by adding a splash of rum or apple brandy to the crumb topping, or sprinkle chopped toasted almonds on top for extra crunch. Fresh lemon zest brightens the apple filling, and a dusting of powdered sugar before serving adds a pretty finishing touch.

Serve Apfelkuchen warm with a dollop of whipped cream or vanilla ice cream. Pair it with a hot cup of coffee or spiced tea for a cozy brunch. It also complements savory dishes like quiche or smoked salmon for a balanced Easter spread.

For a gluten-free version, substitute all-purpose flour with a gluten-free baking blend suitable for yeast doughs. Vegan adaptations can be made by using plant-based milk and butter substitutes, and replacing the egg wash with a maple syrup glaze for shine.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Beat the dough thoroughly for a smooth, elastic texture
  • Use softened butter for easier incorporation and richer flavor
  • Allow the dough to rise in a warm, draft-free spot for best results
  • Press apples evenly into the dough to ensure uniform baking and flavor distribution

structured_content.content: With this Apfelkuchen recipe, you’re set to create a heartwarming, delicious cake that brings joy to your table and confidence to your baking. Enjoy the process and the wonderful aromas filling your kitchen!
